result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph K Lazzaro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days; alternate 4 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph K Lazzaro in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has completed treatment. Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Count #1 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Domestic abuse modifier is stricken. Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court #2 is dismissed and read-in. Court orders the following:
$217.10 to be paid within 60 days or 4 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine.

Defendant Joseph K Lazzaro in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Steinle states that the Defendant will be completing treatment on February 1, 2016. Court will set for plea/sentencing after that.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph K Lazzaro in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steinle requests an adjournment so Defendant can obtain counseling and accept the state's offer.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph K Lazzaro in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steinle states he has not heard from the state regarding offer.  Court sets case for jury status and jury trial.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
(Fax) Dated 05/28/15, from Atty Steinle to Judge Carter, requesting adjournment of 05/29/15 hearing.

Defendant Joseph K Lazzaro in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steinle requests an adjournment so he can speak with charging district attorney.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the witness.
Defendant Joseph K Lazzaro in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
